intro: Micropsis dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-fruited micropsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, low-growing form. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the fruits are small, dry, and covered in stiff hairs. Micropsis dasycarpa is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
